recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Bread Rolls
ingredients: 8-10 slices whole wheat bread (brown bread can also be used)
1 tablespoon coriander leaves (or parsley leaves), chopped
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (or cayenne pepper)
1/2 teaspoon chaat masala powder (or 1/2 teaspoon dry mango powder/amchur)
Oil or softened butter, for brushing
directions: Step 1: Crumble the paneer. If using fresh paneer, it crumbles easily. If using cold or frozen paneer, soak it in warm water for a few minutes, drain well, and pat dry with paper towels before crumbling.
Step 2: In a bowl, combine the crumbled paneer, minced ginger, chopped green chili, and chopped coriander (or parsley) leaves.
Step 3: Add the red chili powder, ground coriander, garam masala, chaat masala (or amchur powder), and salt. Mix thoroughly.
Step 4: Trim the crusts from each bread slice. Lightly flatten each slice with a rolling pin.
Step 5: Save the trimmed crusts. You can pulse them in a mixer-grinder to make breadcrumbs for later use.
Step 6: Place 2 tablespoons of the paneer filling on one side of a bread slice.
Step 7: Moisten the edges of the bread slice with water.
Step 8: Fold the bread slice over the filling to form a rectangular roll. Press the edges to seal.
Step 9: Place the prepared rolls on a baking tray. Lightly brush the tops with oil or softened butter.
Step 10: Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C (390°F) for 10-12 minutes, or until golden brown and crisp. Baking time may vary depending on your oven.
Step 11: Serve the paneer bread rolls hot or warm with tomato ketchup, coriander chutney, or tamarind chutney.

Adjust the spice levels according to your preference.
Serve immediately for the best taste and texture.

recipes.name: Aloo and Paneer Kathi Rolls
ingredients: 1 1/2 cups boiled, peeled, and grated potatoes
directions: 1. In a large bowl, combine all-purpose flour, whole wheat flour, 1/2 tablespoon oil, and salt.  Knead into a soft dough, adding water gradually as needed.
2. Divide the dough into 6 equal portions.  On a lightly floured surface, roll each portion into a 5-inch (12.5 cm) diameter circle.
3. Heat a non-stick griddle or tawa. Cook the rotis partially, until they are lightly cooked but not fully browned. Set aside.
4. Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a separate pan or tawa over medium heat. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
5. Add green chilies and sauté for a few seconds.
6. Add grated potatoes, paneer, cilantro, mint leaves, and salt. Mix well and cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring occasionally.
7. Divide the potato-paneer mixture into 6 equal portions and shape each into an oblong roll. Set aside.
8. Divide the grated carrot and shredded cabbage mixture into 6 equal portions.
9. Spread 1 teaspoon of green chutney evenly over each semi-cooked roti.
10. Place one portion of the potato-paneer filling on one end of the roti, top with a portion of the carrot-cabbage salad, and roll tightly.
11. Repeat steps 9 and 10 to make the remaining 5 rolls.
12. Lightly grease a non-stick tawa or griddle with oil.  Cook the rolls until golden brown and crisp on all sides.
13. Cut each roll diagonally in half and serve hot with tomato ketchup.

recipes.name: Crispy Chicken Spring Rolls
ingredients: 400g boneless, skinless chicken breasts, boiled and shredded
1 bunch spring onions, greens and whites separated and finely chopped
1 cup finely chopped green bell pepper (capsicum)
directions: Step 1: Heat the sesame oil in a wok or large skillet over medium-high heat.
Step 2: Add the garlic and fry for a few seconds until fragrant.
Step 3: Add the white parts of the spring onions and green chilies. Sauté for 30 seconds.
Step 4: Add the cabbage and carrot. Sauté for 2-3 minutes, until softened and any excess moisture evaporates.
Step 5: Add the green bell pepper, celery (if using), shredded chicken, soy sauce, and red chili sauce. Mix well and sauté for 1-2 minutes.
Step 6: Stir in the green parts of the spring onions, salt, and pepper. Sauté for another minute.
Step 7: Remove the filling from the heat and let it cool completely.
Step 8: To assemble the spring rolls, lay a wrapper on a flat surface. Place 1-2 tablespoons of the filling in one corner.
Step 9: Brush the edges of the wrapper with cornstarch slurry.
Step 10: Fold the corner over the filling and roll tightly once to secure. Fold in the sides and continue rolling until you reach the opposite corner, sealing the spring roll completely.
Step 11: Repeat steps 8-10 with the remaining wrappers and filling.
Step 12: Arrange the assembled spring rolls on a tray and refrigerate for at least 45 minutes to firm up.
Step 13: Heat the oil in a deep pot or wok over medium-high heat.
Step 14: Carefully place the spring rolls in the hot oil and deep fry until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes.
Step 15: Remove the spring rolls with a slotted spoon and place them on a plate lined with paper towels to drain excess oil.
Step 16: Serve the spring rolls hot with your favorite chili sauce or dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Paneer Shawarma Wraps
ingredients: 200 grams paneer, cut into strips or cubes
directions: Step 1: Dough Preparation: In a large bowl, combine whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, salt, baking soda, and baking powder. Gradually add water and knead into a soft, slightly sticky dough. Add 2 tablespoons of oil and continue kneading until smooth. Cover and let rest for 30 minutes.

Step 2:  Khubz (Wraps) Preparation: Divide the dough into equal portions. Roll each portion into a thin circle (like a roti or tortilla). Cook each khubz on a medium-hot griddle or skillet until lightly browned on both sides. Wrap the cooked khubz in a clean kitchen towel or aluminum foil to keep them soft.

Step 3: Quick Pickled Salad Preparation: In a saucepan, bring 2 cups of water, a pinch of salt, and a pinch of sugar to a boil. Add chopped carrots, cabbage, cucumber, and onions.  Blanch the vegetables for a minute, then drain and rinse under cold water.  Refrigerate for 10 minutes.  In a bowl, combine the chilled vegetables with mayonnaise, dried oregano, and mixed dried herbs. Mix well.

Step 4: Paneer Marinade: In a bowl, combine hung curd, red chili powder, black pepper powder, dried mango powder, garam masala, coriander powder, ginger paste, tomato ketchup, turmeric powder, Maggi Masala-ae-Magic, and salt. Mix well.
Step 5: Marinate Paneer: Add the paneer strips or cubes to the marinade and coat thoroughly. Let it marinate for at least 15-20 minutes.
Step 6: Cook Paneer: Heat 2 tablespoons of oil in a grill pan or skillet. Grill the marinated paneer until crispy and browned on both sides.
Step 7: Assemble the Shawarma: Take a khubz, spread tomato ketchup and mayonnaise over it. Sprinkle with dried oregano. Place a portion of grilled paneer and the prepared salad on top.
Step 8: Wrap the Shawarma: Roll the khubz tightly, securing with a toothpick if needed.
Step 9: Toast (Optional):  Melt some butter in a pan or on the griddle.  Lightly toast the assembled shawarma wraps until golden brown and crisp.
Step 10: Serve: Serve hot with chutney and extra salad.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Popcorn
ingredients: 1/2 cup rolled oats or quick-cooking oats, coarsely crushed
directions: Step 1: Coarsely crush the oats: In a grinder or food processor, pulse the rolled oats or quick-cooking oats until coarsely crushed. Do not grind to a fine powder. Set aside.

Step 2: Marinate the paneer: In a mixing bowl, combine the paneer cubes, 1/2 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder, dried parsley, dried oregano, black pepper powder, and 1/8 teaspoon salt. Gently mix, ensuring the paneer cubes do not break.

Step 3: Prepare the batter: In another bowl, whisk together the besan, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, 1/2 teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder, baking soda, and salt. Gradually add water, whisking until a thick, smooth batter forms.
Step 4: Coat the paneer: Dip each paneer cube in the batter, ensuring it's fully coated. Allow excess batter to drip off.
Step 5: Crumb coat the paneer: Roll the batter-coated paneer cubes in the crushed oats, pressing gently to ensure they adhere. Set aside.
Step 6: Deep fry the paneer: Heat oil in a deep fryer or large pot over medium heat. Test the oil by dropping a small amount of batter into it; if it rises steadily to the surface, the oil is ready.
Step 7: Fry the paneer: Carefully add the crumb-coated paneer cubes to the hot oil, frying in batches to avoid overcrowding. Fry until golden brown and crispy, turning occasionally.
Step 8: Drain and serve: Remove the fried paneer popcorn with a slotted spoon and place on a plate lined with paper towels to absorb excess oil. Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauce or chutney.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Bread Rolls
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Filling: Heat 2 tablespoons of sunflower oil in a non-stick pan over medium heat.
Step 2: Sauté the spring onion greens and garlic over low heat until fragrant.
Step 3: Add the chopped green chili and sauté for a few more seconds.
Step 4: Add the chopped onion and sauté until translucent.
Step 5: Stir in the red chili sauce, tomato sauce, and soy sauce.
Step 6: Add the crumbled paneer and chopped capsicum. Mix well.
Step 7: Add the vinegar and a pinch of sugar. Adjust seasoning with salt to taste.
Step 8: Cook the mixture over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until almost dry. Set aside to cool.
Step 9: Assemble the Rolls: Cut off the thick edges of the bread slices.
Step 10: Quickly dip each bread slice in water for a second, just to moisten it slightly. Gently press out excess water.
Step 11: Place 1.25 tablespoons of the filling onto the center of each moistened bread slice.
Step 12: Bring the edges of the bread together to enclose the filling completely, shaping it into a roll. Set aside.
Step 13: Deep Fry: Heat sunflower oil in a wok or deep fryer for deep frying.
Step 14: Once the oil is hot, carefully drop the rolls one by one into the hot oil. Fry over medium heat until golden brown and crispy.
Step 15: Remove the fried rolls with a slotted spoon and drain excess oil on kitchen paper.
Step 16: Serve hot with your choice of tomato ketchup, sriracha sauce, or chutney.

recipes.name: Crispy Vegetable Spring Rolls
ingredients: 2 tablespoons neutral oil or sesame oil (not toasted)
½ cup thinly sliced capsicum (green bell pepper)
¾ cup finely chopped French beans (7 to 8 beans)
½ cup chopped spring onion whites (2 to 3 scallions)
75 grams uncooked noodles or 1 cup cooked noodles (optional)
2 to 3 tablespoons chopped spring onion greens
directions: Step 1: Cook noodles according to package directions until al dente. Drain and rinse thoroughly. Set aside.
Step 2: Prepare vegetables: shred cabbage and carrots, thinly slice capsicum, and finely chop French beans and spring onion whites.
Step 3: Heat oil in a wok or frying pan over medium heat. Add spring onion whites and stir.
Step 4: Add all chopped vegetables and increase heat to high. Stir-fry for 4-5 minutes, reducing heat if necessary.
Step 5: Add black pepper, celery (if using), and soy sauce. Adjust seasoning to taste.
Step 6: Add cooked noodles and salt. Stir well, ensuring the filling is dry.
Step 7: Remove from heat and stir in spring onion greens. Let cool completely.
Step 8: Make a paste by whisking together all-purpose flour (or cornstarch) and water until smooth and thick.
Step 9: Place a spring roll wrapper on a flat surface. Brush the edges with the paste.
Step 10: Place 1-2 tablespoons of filling on one side of the wrapper.
Step 11: Tightly roll the wrapper, sealing the edges with the paste.
Step 12: Heat oil for deep frying to 180-190°C (356-374°F).
Step 13: Gently slide spring rolls into the hot oil, frying in batches until golden brown and crispy.
Step 14: Remove spring rolls with a slotted spoon and drain on paper towels.
Step 15: Garnish with spring onion greens or coriander leaves (optional). Serve hot with your preferred dipping sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy vegetable spring rolls on a dark slate surface, angled slightly to reveal the filling.  Use soft, diffused natural light from the side to highlight the golden-brown texture and vibrant vegetable colors.  A shallow depth of field should focus on the cut end of a spring roll, revealing the fresh ingredients. Garnish with a small bowl of sweet chili dipping sauce and scattered chopped spring onions. The overall mood should be bright, fresh, and appetizing.

recipes.name: Paneer Stuffed Kulcha
ingredients: 200 grams paneer (cottage cheese), crumbled or grated
½ teaspoon ajwain (carom seeds) or cumin seeds
½ teaspoon dry mango powder (amchur powder)
Oil or ghee as required for roasting
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, all-purpose flour, baking soda, curd, oil (or ghee), sugar, and salt.

Step 2: Gradually add ¼ cup of water and mix with your hands or a spoon. Continue adding water in small increments until a smooth and soft dough forms. The amount of water needed may vary depending on the flour quality.
Step 3: Knead the dough for 5-7 minutes until smooth and elastic. Cover the dough and let it rest for 2 hours.

Step 4: While the dough rests, prepare the paneer filling. Crumble or grate the paneer. Add the chopped coriander leaves, green chilies, red chili powder, garam masala, ajwain (or cumin), dry mango powder, and salt. Mix well.
Step 5: After 2 hours, lightly knead the dough again. Divide the dough into medium-sized balls. Optionally, cover and let rest for 15-20 minutes.
Step 6: Dust a dough ball with flour and roll it into a 5-6 inch diameter circle.
Step 7: Place 2-3 tablespoons of the paneer filling in the center of the rolled dough, leaving a 1-1.5 inch border.
Step 8: Bring the edges of the dough together and pinch to seal in the filling. Sprinkle with sesame seeds (optional) and lightly press them into the dough.
Step 9: Gently roll the stuffed kulcha into a larger disc, about 6-7 inches in diameter.

Step 10: Heat a tava or griddle over medium heat. Cook the kulcha for 2-3 minutes per side, or until golden brown spots appear and the filling is heated through. Apply oil or ghee as desired while cooking.
Step 11: Once cooked, transfer the kulcha to a roti basket or serving plate. Spread with butter and serve hot.

Use soft, diffused natural light to highlight the textures. A rustic wooden backdrop and a linen napkin should complement the kulcha. Garnish with a sprinkle of coriander and a dollop of yogurt on the side.  Shallow depth of field, focusing on the filling, with a warm, inviting mood.

recipes.name: Paneer Pulao (Indian Rice Pilaf with Paneer)
ingredients: ½ teaspoon caraway seeds (shahi jeera, optional)
1 black cardamom pod (seeds removed, husks discarded, optional)
2-3 green cardamom pods (whole or seeds removed)
1 small piece stone flower (pathar phool or kalpasi, optional)
1 ½ cups basmati rice or pulao rice
2 tablespoons ghee or oil (for the pulao)
2-3 teaspoons ghee or oil (for pan-frying paneer)
3-3 ¼ cups water, or as needed
1-inch piece ginger, 2-3 garlic cloves, and 1 green chili (crushed to a paste)
1 ½-2 tablespoons chopped fresh mint leaves
directions: 1. Prepare the Pulao Masala: In a small dry grinder or coffee grinder, combine the cumin seeds, caraway seeds (if using), fennel seeds (if using), black cardamom seeds (if using), green cardamom seeds (if using), cloves, cinnamon, mace, and stone flower (if using). Grind to a fine powder and set aside.
2. Prepare the Rice: Rinse the basmati rice under cold water until the water runs clear. Soak the rice in enough water for 20-30 minutes. Drain and set aside.
3. Prepare the Aromatics and Paneer: Thinly slice the onion, chop the mint leaves, and crush the ginger, garlic, and green chili into a paste.

4. Sauté the Onions and Spices: Heat 2 tablespoons of ghee or oil in a large pot or pan over medium heat. Add the bay leaf and sauté for a few seconds. Add the sliced onions and sauté until golden brown or caramelized.
5. Add Aromatics: Add the ginger-garlic-chili paste and sauté until the raw aroma disappears (about 10-15 seconds). Stir in the chopped mint leaves and the ground pulao masala. Sauté for 5-8 seconds.
6. Add Peas (Optional): If using peas or other vegetables, add them to the pot and sauté for 2-3 minutes.
7. Add Rice and Water: Add the drained rice to the pot and stir gently. Sauté for 1 minute. Pour in the water, lemon juice (if using), and salt. Stir well.

8. Cook the Rice: Cover the pot tightly with a lid and bring the mixture to a simmer over low to medium heat. Cook until the rice grains are cooked through and the water is absorbed. Add more water if needed during cooking.

9. Pan-fry the Paneer: While the rice is cooking, cut the paneer into cubes. Heat 2-3 teaspoons of ghee or oil in a non-stick pan or well-seasoned tawa/griddle over medium heat. Add the paneer cubes and pan-fry until light golden brown. Do not overfry. Set aside.
10. Combine Paneer and Rice: Once the rice is cooked, turn off the heat and let it sit for 5 minutes. Gently mix in the pan-fried paneer cubes.

11. Rest and Serve: Cover the pot again and let the paneer absorb the flavors of the pulao for another 5 minutes. Serve hot or warm, garnished with fresh mint leaves and extra pan-fried paneer cubes. Serve with raita, dal fry, or dal tadka, if desired.

recipes.name: Paneer 65
ingredients: ½ teaspoon Red chili powder or Kashmiri red chili powder
½ to ¾ teaspoon Garam masala powder
directions: Step 1: In a mixing bowl, combine rice flour, besan, and corn starch.
Step 2: Add green chili paste, garlic paste, ginger paste, red chili powder, garam masala, lime juice, and salt. Mix well.
Step 3: Add water and whisk until a smooth paste forms. (Optional: Add a few drops of natural orange food coloring.)
Step 4: Add paneer cubes to the batter and gently mix to coat. Cover and marinate for 15-20 minutes at room temperature.
Step 5: Heat 5 tablespoons of oil in a pan over medium heat.
Step 6: Fry the coated paneer cubes in batches, ensuring they don't stick together, until golden brown and crisp. Avoid overcrowding the pan.
Step 7: Drain the fried paneer on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Step 8: In the same pan, heat 2 teaspoons of oil. Add mustard seeds and let them crackle.
Step 9: Add chopped ginger, garlic, green chilies, dry red chilies, and curry leaves. Sauté for a minute.
Step 10: Add chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
Step 11: Add salt and sugar (optional). Stir well.
Step 12: Add the fried paneer cubes to the pan and toss with the sautéed ingredients.
Step 13: Adjust salt and green chilies as needed. Remove from heat.
Step 14: Garnish with coriander leaves and serve hot as a starter or with chapati, naan, or tandoori roti.

Shallow depth of field, focusing on a few key paneer pieces in the foreground. Aim for a dramatic, inviting mood, showcasing the dish's appetizing appeal.

recipes.name: Paneer Stuffed Whole Wheat Paratha
ingredients: Ghee or Oil, as needed for roasting
directions: 1. In a mixing bowl, combine the whole wheat flour, salt, and ghee or oil.
2. Gradually add ½ cup of water and begin kneading. Add more water as needed, up to ¾ cup total, until a smooth and soft dough forms.
3. Cover the dough and let it rest for 20-30 minutes.
4. While the dough rests, prepare the filling. Grate the paneer and combine it with the chopped green chilies, dry mango powder, garam masala, red chili powder, and salt.
5. Mix the filling ingredients thoroughly, ensuring the spices are evenly distributed.
6. Divide the dough into small, equal-sized balls.
7. Dust a dough ball with flour and roll it into a 4-5 inch circle.
8. Place a portion of the paneer filling on one half of the rolled circle, leaving a 1-inch border.
9. Fold the other half of the dough circle over the filling to form a semi-circle and seal the edges firmly.
10. Dust the filled paratha with flour and roll it out again into a 6-7 inch circle.
11. Heat a tava or griddle. To test the heat, sprinkle a pinch of flour on the tava; it should brown quickly.
12. Place the rolled paratha on the hot tava.
13. Cook until the underside is partially cooked (about halfway), then flip.
14. Apply ghee or oil to the cooked side and flip again when the second side is halfway cooked.
15. Cook the second side until golden brown spots appear, applying ghee or oil as needed.
16. Press the edges of the paratha with a spatula to ensure they are cooked through.
17. Repeat steps 7-16 for the remaining dough and filling.
18. Stack the cooked parathas in a roti basket or casserole, spreading butter or ghee between each layer (optional).
19. Serve the paneer parathas hot with yogurt, pickle, or a cup of ginger tea.

recipes.name: Kadai Paneer
ingredients: 5-6 Kashmiri red chilies, broken and deseeded
4 tablespoons butter or oil or ghee
1.5 inches ginger and 7-8 medium cloves garlic, crushed to a paste
1 medium green bell pepper/capsicum, thinly sliced
2 tablespoons chopped coriander leaves, for garnish
2 tablespoons light cream or 1 tablespoon heavy cream (optional)
directions: 1. Dry roast coriander seeds and Kashmiri red chilies in a pan over low heat until fragrant. Let cool and grind into a semi-fine powder. Set aside.
2. Prepare the vegetables: Finely chop the onions, julienne the bell pepper/capsicum, finely chop 2 tomatoes, and puree the remaining 5 tomatoes in a blender.
3. In a large pan or kadai, heat butter/oil/ghee. Add the ginger-garlic paste and sauté until fragrant.
4. Add the chopped onions and sauté until translucent.
5. Add the ground spice mixture and chopped green chilies. Mix well.
6. Add the finely chopped tomatoes and sauté until pulpy and oil begins to separate from the mixture.
7. Add the tomato puree and continue sautéing for 9-10 minutes over low heat, until oil separates from the sides.
8. Add the julienned bell pepper/capsicum and simmer for 2-3 minutes.
9. Add water and salt. Simmer for 7-8 minutes.
10. Add kasuri methi and garam masala powder. Stir well.
11. Gently add the paneer cubes. Cook for 1-2 minutes.
12. (Optional) Stir in cream.
13. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves. Serve hot with roti, naan, steamed rice, or jeera rice.

Focus on the paneer and vibrant sauce, highlighting the textures of the onions, peppers, and chilies. Use a shallow depth of field to blur the rustic, textured background.  Garnish with a sprinkle of garam masala and coriander leaves. Employ warm, inviting lighting to create a mood of comfort and richness. recipes.name: Cinnamon Roll Apple Pie
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9-inch pie pan with nonstick baking spray.
Step 2: On a lightly floured surface, roll out each cinnamon roll until it is about 1/8 inch thick and roughly the size of your palm in diameter.
Step 3: Arrange the rolled-out cinnamon rolls in the prepared pie pan, pinching the seams together to form a bottom crust.
Step 4: Pour the apple pie filling into the cinnamon roll crust and spread evenly.
Step 5: Top the apple pie filling with another layer of rolled-out cinnamon rolls, pinching the seams to seal the pie.
Step 6: Cover the pie with aluminum foil and bake for 30 minutes.
Step 7: Remove the foil and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until the cinnamon rolls are golden brown.
Step 8: Let the pie cool completely before drizzling with the icing included with the cinnamon rolls.

Garnish with a scoop of vanilla bean ice cream melting onto the pie and a sprinkle of cinnamon.  A linen napkin and wooden serving spoon in the background add a touch of homey warmth. Moody and comforting atmosphere.

recipes.name: Baked Salmon Sushi Roll with Sweet Ponzu Glaze
ingredients: 4 oz Cream cheese, cut into 1/2-inch strips
1/3 lb Imitation crab meat, shredded OR 1/3 lb Fresh lump crab meat
directions: Step 1: Rinse the sushi rice in a fine-mesh sieve under cold water until the water runs clear. Cook according to package directions.
Step 2: While the rice is cooking, prepare the sweet ponzu glaze. In a small saucepan, combine 1/4 cup ponzu sauce, 1/2 cup mirin, 1/2 cup sugar, and 1/2 cup chicken stock.
Step 3: Bring the glaze to a simmer over medium heat and cook until reduced by half, about 10-15 minutes. Remove from heat and let cool.
Step 4: Once the rice is cooked, gently fold in 1/4 cup mirin, 1/4 cup sugar, and 1/4 cup rice vinegar. Spread the rice on a baking sheet or large plate to cool slightly.
Step 5: Prepare the filling ingredients: peel, deseed, and julienne the cucumber; cut the cream cheese into strips; shred the imitation crab meat (if using).
Step 6: Place a sheet of nori on a piece of plastic wrap. Spread a thin, even layer of cooled sushi rice over the nori, leaving a small border at the top edge.

Step 7: Carefully flip the nori over so the rice is facing down. Arrange the cream cheese, cucumber, and crab meat in a line across the nori, about 1 inch from the bottom edge. Add a few drops of chili sauce if desired.
Step 8: Using the plastic wrap as an aid, tightly roll the sushi away from you, tucking in the filling as you roll. Gently squeeze the roll to seal it.
Step 9: Cut the salmon fillet into thin strips, about 1/2-inch wide and slightly longer than the sushi roll. Place the salmon strips over the top of the roll, covering the entire surface.

Step 10: Wrap the roll tightly with the plastic wrap again and gently press it to ensure the salmon adheres to the roll.  Slice the wrapped roll into 6-8 equal pieces with a sharp, wet knife, leaving the plastic wrap in place.
Step 11: Preheat the oven to broil. Place the sliced sushi roll onto a baking sheet sprayed with cooking spray. Remove plastic wrap.
Step 12: Broil for 3-5 minutes, or until the salmon is cooked through and slightly caramelized.
Step 13: Serve immediately, drizzled with the cooled sweet ponzu glaze and garnished with sliced green onions.

recipes.name: Alton Brown's Overnight Cinnamon Rolls
ingredients: 4 cups all-purpose flour, plus additional for dusting
directions: 1. In a stand mixer bowl, whisk together egg yolks, whole egg, granulated sugar, melted butter, and buttermilk.
2. Add 2 cups of flour, yeast, and salt. Whisk until combined.
3. Switch to the dough hook. Add the remaining flour (reserve 3/4 cup) and knead on low for 5 minutes.
4. Check dough consistency, adding more flour if needed. Dough should be soft, moist, but not sticky.
5. Knead for another 5 minutes, or until dough clears the bowl's sides.
6. Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface. Knead by hand for 30 seconds.
7. Lightly oil a large bowl. Place dough inside, oil the top, cover, and let double (2-2.5 hours).
8. In a medium bowl, combine brown sugar, cinnamon, and salt. Mix well and set aside.
9. Butter a 9x13 inch baking dish.
10. Turn risen dough onto a lightly floured surface and shape into a rectangle.
11. Roll into an 18x12 inch rectangle.
12. Brush with 1 1/2 tablespoons melted butter, leaving a 1/2-inch top border.
13. Sprinkle filling mix over dough, leaving a 3/4-inch top border. Press filling gently into the dough.
14. Starting with the long edge, tightly roll dough into a cylinder.
15. Pinch the seam to seal, and place seam-down.
16. Gently squeeze the cylinder for even thickness.
17. Slice into 1 1/2-inch rolls (12 rolls).
18. Arrange rolls cut-side down in the dish. Cover tightly and refrigerate overnight (up to 16 hours).
19. Place the cold rolls in an unheated oven. Place a pan of boiling water below the rolls. Close the oven and let rise for 30 minutes.
20. Remove rolls and water pan. Preheat oven to 350°F.
21. Bake rolls for 30 minutes, or until golden brown and 190°F internally.
22. While rolls cool slightly, make the icing: Whisk cream cheese until creamy, then add milk and whisk until combined.
23. Sift in powdered sugar and whisk until smooth.
24. Spread icing over rolls and serve immediately.

recipes.name: Crispy Air Fryer Spring Rolls
ingredients: ½ cup finely sliced green onions
¼ cup Thai sweet chili sauce
directions: Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a large pan or wok over medium heat. Add the napa cabbage, bean sprouts, carrots, and shiitake mushrooms. Stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until slightly softened.

Step 2: Combine 1 tablespoon of cornstarch with 1 tablespoon of water to create a slurry. Add the green onions, cornstarch slurry, sugar, salt, and pepper to the pan. Cook for 1-2 minutes until the vegetables are cooked but still slightly crisp. Remove from heat and set aside.
Step 3: Preheat the air fryer to 400°F (200°C).

Step 4: Lay an egg roll wrapper in a diamond shape. Brush a cornstarch slurry (1 tablespoon cornstarch mixed with 1 tablespoon water) along the top corner. Place 3 tablespoons of filling in the center.
Step 5: Fold the bottom third of the wrapper over the filling, then fold in the left and right corners. Roll from the bottom up, sealing the edge with cornstarch slurry.
Step 6: Brush the spring rolls with vegetable oil and arrange them in the air fryer basket, leaving space between them. Cook in batches if necessary.
Step 7: Air fry for 12-15 minutes, flipping halfway through, until golden brown and crispy.
Step 8: In a small bowl, whisk together the sweet chili sauce, white vinegar, and cilantro. Adjust to taste. Serve the spring rolls immediately with the dipping sauce.

recipes.name: Matar Paneer (Indian Cheese and Peas Curry)
ingredients: ½ teaspoon Kashmiri red chili powder or ¼ to ½ teaspoon red chili powder or cayenne pepper
½ teaspoon garam masala powder or Punjabi garam masala powder
1 tablespoon light or heavy cream or malai (optional)
1 cup (130 grams) fresh or frozen green peas
1 to 1 ¼ cups water (for stove-top pressure cooker) or 1 cup water (for Instant Pot)
250 to 300 grams paneer (Indian cottage cheese), cubed
½ teaspoon crushed kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves)
1 to 2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves (cilantro)
¾ to 1 cup (120 grams) chopped tomatoes or 3 medium tomatoes
½ cup (60 grams) chopped onions or 1 medium onion
1 teaspoon chopped green chilies or serrano peppers or 1 to 2 green chilies
1 teaspoon chopped ginger or 1-inch piece ginger
1 teaspoon chopped garlic or 3 to 4 medium garlic cloves
1-inch cinnamon stick or ½-inch cassia cinnamon stick
directions: 1. Prepare the Masala Paste: Combine onions, tomatoes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, cashews, coriander leaves, black peppercorns, cinnamon, cardamom (if using), coriander seeds, and cloves in a grinder or blender.
2. Grind to a smooth paste. Add 2 to 3 tablespoons of water if needed to facilitate blending. Ensure no cashew chunks remain.
3. Sauté the Masala Paste: Heat oil or ghee in a 2-liter pressure cooker or a heavy pan. Add cumin seeds and fry until they splutter. (For Instant Pot instructions, see step 9).
4. Add the ground masala paste and sauté for 10-12 minutes over medium-low heat, stirring frequently, until the oil separates and the paste thickens and becomes glossy. Be cautious of splattering.
5. Add Spices and Peas: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and garam masala powder. Mix well. If using, stir in cream or malai and sauté for a minute.
6. Add green peas and mix. Add water and salt.

7. Pressure Cook (Stove-top): Cover the cooker tightly and pressure cook for 2-3 whistles or 9-10 minutes. Allow the pressure to release naturally. For pan cooking, cover and cook until peas soften. For Instant Pot instructions, see step 9.

8. Adjust Consistency and Add Paneer: Once the pressure has released naturally (or peas are cooked in a pan), open the lid. If the curry is too thin, simmer until it reaches a medium consistency. If it's too thick, add a little water and simmer.

9. Instant Pot Instructions: Press the "Sauté" button. Add oil and cumin seeds; fry until they splutter. Add masala paste and sauté until thickened and glossy. Adjust "Sauté" setting to "Less" if needed. Add spice powders, green peas, 1 cup water, and salt. Press "Cancel."

10. Seal the Instant Pot lid and set the valve to "Sealing." Press "Pressure Cook/Manual" and set the time to 3 minutes on high pressure. Allow a 5-minute natural pressure release, then quick release any remaining pressure.

11. Add Paneer and Finish: Add paneer cubes to the curry (stove-top, pan, or Instant Pot). Mix gently and simmer briefly until the paneer is heated through. Do not overcook. Add sugar (optional) before adding the paneer.
12. Garnish and Serve: Garnish with coriander leaves and kasuri methi (if using). Serve hot with roti, paratha, naan, rice, or puri.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Cutlets
ingredients: ¾ cup Green Peas, fresh or frozen
200 grams Paneer, crumbled or grated (1¾ cups)
¼ teaspoon Red Chili Powder or Cayenne Pepper
3-4 tablespoons Rice Flour (or Cornstarch, Arrowroot Flour, or Roasted Gram Flour)
3 tablespoons Semolina (or Breadcrumbs, Crushed Oats, or Crushed Corn Flakes)
directions: Step 1: Pressure cook the potatoes, carrot, and green peas with 2 cups of water for 3-4 whistles. Allow the pressure to release naturally, then open the lid. Alternatively, boil the vegetables in a pan or Instant Pot until tender.
Step 2: Drain the vegetables and let them cool completely.
Step 3: In a mortar and pestle, crush the green chili, garlic, and ginger into a semi-fine paste. Set aside.
Step 4: Crumble or grate the paneer. Set aside.
Step 5: Mash the cooled vegetables in a bowl.
Step 6: Add the ginger-garlic-chili paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala, and salt to the mashed vegetables.
Step 7: Add the crumbled paneer and rice flour (or substitute) to the mixture.
Step 8: Stir in the chopped coriander leaves. Mix well and adjust seasoning.
Step 9: Shape the mixture into cutlets.
Step 10: Coat each cutlet in semolina (or breadcrumbs, crushed oats, or corn flakes).
Step 11: Heat oil in a pan over medium heat. Fry the cutlets until golden brown and crisp on both sides.
Step 12: Drain the cutlets on paper towels to remove excess oil.
Step 13: Serve hot with your favorite chutney or sauce.

recipes.name: Cinnamon Rolls with Toasted Marshmallows
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Lightly grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
Step 2: In a small bowl, combine the granulated sugar, ground cinnamon, and graham cracker crumbs. Set aside.
Step 3: Unroll the crescent roll dough and press the perforations together to form two large rectangles. Spread the softened butter evenly over the dough.
Step 4: Sprinkle the cinnamon-sugar-graham cracker mixture evenly over the buttered dough. Top with the chocolate chips.
Step 5: Tightly roll up each rectangle of dough lengthwise. Slice each roll into 6 equal pieces, approximately 1 1/2 inches thick.
Step 6: Arrange the cinnamon rolls in the prepared baking dish.
Step 7: Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until golden brown.
Step 8: While the rolls bake, whisk together the powdered sugar and milk in a small bowl to make a glaze.
Step 9: Remove the cinnamon rolls from the oven and drizzle with the powdered sugar glaze.
Step 10: Turn the oven to broil on high.
Step 11: Place one large marshmallow on top of each cinnamon roll.
Step 12: Broil for 2-3 minutes, or until the marshmallows are golden brown and toasted.

recipes.name: Paneer Khurchan (Scrambled Indian Cheese)
ingredients: 250 grams paneer, cut into 1.5 to 2-inch batons
1 large green bell pepper, finely diced
½ to ¾ teaspoon red chili powder or cayenne pepper
½ teaspoon kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves), crushed
2 tablespoons chopped fresh coriander leaves, for garnish
directions: Step 1: Prepare the Paneer: Cut the paneer into batons or strips about 1.5 to 2 inches long.

Step 2: Prepare the Vegetables: Thinly slice the onions, chop the tomatoes, and finely dice the bell pepper. Slit the green chilies and julienne the ginger. Reserve a few ginger juliennes for garnish.
Step 3: Sauté the Vegetables: Heat oil in a medium to large iron tawa or kadai (wok) over medium-low heat. Add the sliced onions and sauté until translucent, stirring often.

Step 4: Add Tomatoes and Peppers: Add the diced bell pepper and chopped tomatoes to the pan. Continue sautéing and stirring for 7-8 minutes, until the tomatoes soften and the bell pepper is slightly cooked.
Step 5: Incorporate Spices: Add the turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder, cumin powder, garam masala powder, asafoetida, and salt. Stir well to combine with the vegetables.
Step 6: Add Chilies and Ginger: Add the slit green chilies and julienned ginger to the pan. Stir and mix.
Step 7: Cook the Paneer: Add the paneer batons to the pan and stir well. Increase the heat to high. Arrange the paneer strips so they are in contact with the tawa to brown evenly.

Step 8: Brown and Scrape: Cook for about a minute, then scrape the paneer strips from the tawa. Reduce heat if browning too quickly. Turn the paneer over and brown the other side. Continue scraping and stirring to prevent sticking.
Step 9: Finish and Garnish: Turn off the heat. Add the cream (if using) and crushed kasuri methi. Stir well. Garnish with chopped coriander leaves and reserved ginger juliennes.
Step 10: Serve: Serve the paneer khurchan hot or warm, optionally sprinkled with lime juice, alongside chapatis, rotis, naan, or paratha.

recipes.name: Crispy Paneer Patties
ingredients: 125 grams Paneer (Indian cottage cheese), crumbled or grated
1/2 teaspoon Black Pepper powder or freshly crushed Black Pepper
4-5 tablespoons Oil or Ghee, for frying
directions: Step 1: Rinse the potatoes thoroughly and boil them with some salt in a pressure cooker or Instant Pot until tender. Allow to cool, then peel and mash in a bowl.
Step 2: Add the crumbled or grated paneer, black pepper, cornflour, and salt to the mashed potatoes.
Step 3: Mix thoroughly until smooth and even. Add more cornflour if the mixture is too loose.
Step 4: Shape the mixture into even-sized balls, then flatten them into patties.
Step 5: Heat oil or ghee in a skillet over medium-low to medium heat.
Step 6: Fry the patties in batches until golden brown and crisp on both sides, turning as needed.
Step 7: Remove the patties and place them on absorbent napkins to drain excess oil.
Step 8: Serve hot with tomato ketchup, mint chutney, coriander chutney, or tamarind chutney.

recipes.name: Shanghai Spring Rolls
ingredients: 1/2 lb small shrimp, peeled and deveined, roughly chopped
8-10 dried Chinese mushrooms, rehydrated and shredded
Vegetable oil, for stir-frying and deep-frying
2 tablespoons cornstarch mixed with 2 tablespoons water, to make a slurry
directions: Step 1: Heat 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add the shredded pork and stir-fry until no longer pink. Add the shredded chicken and stir-fry until cooked through. Add the shrimp and stir-fry until pink and opaque. Remove the cooked meats from the wok and set aside.
Step 2: Add a little more oil to the wok if needed. Stir-fry the scallions for a few seconds, then add the mushrooms and cabbage. Stir-fry until the cabbage wilts, about 2-3 minutes.
Step 3: In a small bowl, combine the chicken stock, salt, dry sherry, and sugar. Add this sauce to the wok with the vegetables. Bring to a boil and thicken with the cornstarch slurry.
Step 4: Return the cooked meats to the wok. Stir in the sesame oil. Remove from heat and set aside to cool completely.

Step 5: Lay an egg roll wrapper on a flat surface with one corner pointing towards you. Place a spoonful of the filling in the center of the wrapper. Fold the bottom corner over the filling, then fold in the sides and tightly roll up to the top corner, sealing with beaten egg.

Step 6: Heat vegetable oil in a deep fryer or large pot to 325°F (160°C). Deep-fry the spring rolls in batches until lightly golden, about 5-7 minutes. Remove and drain on paper towels. (Spring rolls can be frozen at this point. Defrost before continuing).
Step 7: When ready to serve, heat the oil to 375°F (190°C). Deep-fry the spring rolls again until golden brown and crisp, about 2-3 minutes. Drain on paper towels and serve immediately.

scenes.voice_over: Welcome to my kitchen! Today, we're making Shanghai spring rolls, a delicious and savory treat perfect for any occasion. These crispy rolls are packed with a flavorful filling of pork, chicken, shrimp, and vegetables, guaranteed to satisfy your cravings.

scenes.image_prompt: Ingredients neatly arranged on a wooden board: shredded pork, shredded chicken, chopped shrimp, shredded cabbage, dried Chinese mushrooms (rehydrated), and chopped scallions.
scenes.voice_over: Here are the ingredients you'll need. We've got shredded pork, chicken, and shrimp for our protein base. Then we have our veggies: shredded cabbage, rehydrated Chinese mushrooms, and scallions to add freshness and flavor.

scenes.image_prompt: Pork, chicken, and shrimp are being stir-fried in a wok over high heat. The wok is tilted slightly, showing the meat browning.
scenes.voice_over: Start by stir-frying the pork, chicken, and shrimp in hot oil until they are fully cooked. This should take about 5-7 minutes.  Once cooked, remove the meats from the wok and set them aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Cabbage, mushrooms, and scallions are being stir-fried in a wok. The vegetables are glistening and appear slightly softened.
scenes.voice_over: Add the scallions, mushrooms, and cabbage to the wok and stir-fry for 2-3 minutes until the cabbage wilts. It’s important not to overcook the vegetables to keep them crunchy.

scenes.image_prompt: A small bowl containing the sauce ingredients: chicken stock, salt, dry sherry, and sugar. A whisk is in the bowl, mixing the ingredients.
scenes.voice_over: In a bowl, whisk together the chicken stock, salt, dry sherry, and sugar. Pour this flavorful sauce over the vegetables in the wok.  Let it come to a boil, then thicken with the cornstarch slurry.

scenes.image_prompt: The cooked meats are being returned to the wok with the vegetables and sauce. Sesame oil is drizzled over the mixture. Everything is stirred together.
scenes.voice_over: Return the cooked meats to the wok. Stir in a tablespoon of sesame oil for that authentic aroma. Mix everything thoroughly. Now, remove the filling from the heat and let it cool completely before assembling our spring rolls.

scenes.image_prompt: Hands demonstrating the process of filling and rolling an egg roll wrapper with the filling, sealing the edge with beaten egg.
scenes.voice_over: Place a wrapper on a flat surface with a corner facing you. Add a spoonful of filling in the center, fold in the sides and roll it up tightly, sealing the edge with a little bit of beaten egg.

scenes.image_prompt: Spring rolls are being deep-fried in a pot with hot oil. They are golden brown and bubbling.
scenes.voice_over: Heat your oil to 325°F. Gently fry the spring rolls in batches until lightly golden for about 5-7 minutes. At this stage you can freeze them for later, if you like.

scenes.image_prompt: Golden-brown, crispy spring rolls are being removed from the deep fryer with a slotted spoon and placed on a wire rack with paper towels underneath.
scenes.voice_over: Increase the oil temperature to 375°F and fry the spring rolls again until golden brown and crispy, for about 2-3 minutes.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished Shanghai spring rolls arranged on a serving plate, garnished with chopped scallions and a small bowl of dipping sauce in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Serve your crispy Shanghai spring rolls immediately with your favorite dipping sauce. I hope you enjoy this recipe!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy spring rolls, double fry them as directed. The first fry cooks the filling and wrapper, while the second fry crisps them up perfectly.
If freezing the spring rolls, arrange them in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Once frozen, transfer them to a freezer bag for longer storage.

recipes.name: Crispy Baked Egg Rolls
ingredients: 2 (8-ounce) cans bamboo shoots, drained and chopped
1/2 cup dried mushrooms, cut into strips
directions: Step 1: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line baking sheets with nonstick foil.

Step 2: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in a large pan over medium heat. Add bamboo shoots and bean sprouts and cook until heated through. Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce and sauté until vegetables are coated. Remove from pan and set aside.
Step 3: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in the same pan. Sauté dried mushrooms and onion until softened. Remove from pan and set aside.
Step 4: In a medium bowl, combine ground chicken, remaining 1 tablespoon soy sauce, dry sherry, 1 tablespoon cornstarch, and salt.
Step 5: Heat 1 tablespoon peanut oil in the same pan. Cook ground chicken mixture until cooked through and no longer pink.
Step 6: Return cooked vegetables and ginger to the pan with the chicken. Stir to combine. Remove from heat and let cool.
Step 7: In a small bowl, whisk together remaining 1 tablespoon cornstarch and cold water.
Step 8: Place an egg roll wrapper on a work surface. Moisten edges with cornstarch mixture. Spoon filling diagonally in the center.
Step 9: Fold bottom corner over filling, roll snugly halfway. Fold in sides, moisten top edge, and roll to seal. Place seam-down on prepared baking sheet.
Step 10: Repeat filling and rolling process with remaining wrappers.
Step 11: Brush tops of egg rolls with remaining peanut oil.
Step 12: Place a pan half-filled with water on the bottom oven rack. Place the baking sheet with egg rolls on a rack above the water pan. Bake for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway through.
Step 13: Serve hot with your favorite dipping sauces, such as sweet and sour sauce, hot Chinese mustard, or soy sauce.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture crispy baked egg rolls on a dark slate surface, garnished with fresh cilantro and a small bowl of sweet chili sauce.  Use a slightly overhead, angled shot to showcase the golden-brown texture and crimped edges.  Shallow depth of field focuses on the foreground egg roll with soft focus on others in the background.  Moody, dramatic lighting emphasizes the textures and steam rising gently.  Include chopsticks delicately placed beside an open egg roll revealing the savory filling.

video_script.title: Crispy Baked Egg Rolls
video_script.description: Learn how to make crispy, flavorful egg rolls at home, baked instead of fried!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of golden-brown, crispy baked egg rolls, served with small bowls of sweet and sour sauce and hot mustard.
scenes.voice_over: Craving takeout? Skip the delivery and make these irresistible crispy baked egg rolls! They're surprisingly easy and healthier than fried.

scenes.image_prompt: Show grouped ingredients: peanut oil, bamboo shoots, bean sprouts, soy sauce.  Text overlay for each ingredient.
scenes.voice_over: Let's start with the veggies. We'll need peanut oil, bamboo shoots, bean sprouts, and soy sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Show grouped ingredients: Dried mushrooms, onion, ground chicken, dry sherry, cornstarch, salt, ginger. Text overlay for each ingredient.
scenes.voice_over: For the filling, we'll use ground chicken, dried mushrooms, onion, dry sherry, cornstarch, salt, and ginger. Don't forget that extra touch of flavor from freshly chopped ginger.

scenes.image_prompt: Show pan with bamboo shoots and bean sprouts being sauteed. Steam rising from the pan.
scenes.voice_over: Heat one tablespoon of peanut oil in a pan over medium heat. Add the bamboo shoots and bean sprouts. Sauté until heated through and coated with two tablespoons of soy sauce.

scenes.image_prompt: Show the mushrooms and onions being sauteed in the pan.
scenes.voice_over: In the same pan, sauté the dried mushrooms and onions until softened in another tablespoon of peanut oil. Set aside.

scenes.image_prompt: Show ground chicken being cooked in the pan, breaking it apart with a spatula.
scenes.voice_over: Combine the ground chicken with one tablespoon of soy sauce, dry sherry, one tablespoon of cornstarch, and salt. Cook until browned and no longer pink.

scenes.image_prompt: Show combined cooked chicken, vegetables, and ginger in the pan.
scenes.voice_over: Return the vegetables and ginger to the pan with the cooked chicken. Mix everything well and remove from heat to cool.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of hands filling and rolling an egg roll, showing the folding technique.
scenes.voice_over: Mix one tablespoon of cornstarch with cold water. Place a wrapper on a flat surface, moisten edges, spoon filling diagonally, and roll snugly, folding in the sides as you go. Seal with the cornstarch mixture.

scenes.image_prompt: Show egg rolls arranged seam-down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper, being brushed with oil.
scenes.voice_over: Place the filled egg rolls seam-down on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Brush the tops with the remaining peanut oil. Place a pan of water on the bottom rack of the oven. Bake at 400°F (200°C) for 25-30 minutes, flipping halfway.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of crispy baked egg rolls on a serving platter, garnished with chopped green onions, served with dipping sauces.
scenes.voice_over: Serve these delicious egg rolls hot with your favorite dipping sauces, such as sweet and sour sauce, hot mustard, or soy sauce. Enjoy!

cooking_tips: For extra crispy egg rolls, you can lightly spray the egg rolls with cooking spray before baking.
If you don't have dried mushrooms, you can use fresh shiitake or cremini mushrooms.
Feel free to add other vegetables to the filling, such as shredded carrots or cabbage.

recipes.name: Palak Paneer (Spinach with Indian Cheese)
ingredients: 1/3 cup finely chopped onion (1 small-medium onion)
1 teaspoon finely chopped garlic (4-5 small cloves)
1/3 cup finely chopped tomato (1 small-medium tomato)
1/2 teaspoon red chili powder (or cayenne pepper/paprika)
2 tablespoons low-fat cream (or 1 tablespoon heavy cream)
1 teaspoon kasuri methi (dried fenugreek leaves, optional)
directions: Step 1: Rinse the spinach thoroughly under running water. Discard stringy stems.
Step 2: Boil 3 cups of water in a pan. Add 1/2 teaspoon salt. Add spinach to boiling water and blanch for 1 minute.
Step 3: Transfer spinach to an ice bath to preserve its color. Let it sit for 1 minute, then drain.
Step 4: Blend spinach, ginger, garlic, and green chilies into a smooth puree.
Step 5: Heat oil/ghee/butter in a pan. Add cumin seeds and let them splutter.
Step 6: Add the bay leaf and sautéed chopped onions until golden brown.
Step 7: Add chopped garlic and sauté until fragrant.
Step 8: Add chopped tomatoes and sauté until softened.
Step 9: Add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and asafoetida. Mix well.
Step 10: Add the spinach puree and mix well.
Step 11: Add 1/2 cup water (or as needed). Simmer for 6-7 minutes, or until spinach is cooked and the sauce thickens. Season with salt.
Step 12: Add garam masala powder and mix.
Step 13: Gently add paneer cubes and stir. Do not overcook.
Step 14: Stir in cream and remove from heat.
Step 15: Garnish with cream/butter, ginger juliennes, and lemon/lime wedges. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice.
recipes.image_prompt: Capture a vibrant Palak Paneer in a rustic earthenware bowl, garnished with a dollop of cream and a sprinkle of red chili flakes.  Use a dark, textured background with a shallow depth of field, focusing on the paneer cubes and the glistening spinach. Employ soft, diffused lighting to highlight the rich green hue and creamy texture. Shoot from a slightly elevated angle to showcase the dish's depth and richness, creating a warm, inviting mood.  Incorporate a torn piece of naan bread in the foreground, subtly blurred.

video_script.title: Restaurant-Style Palak Paneer: Easy & Delicious
video_script.description: Learn how to make creamy and flavorful Palak Paneer at home with this easy-to-follow recipe. Perfect with roti, naan, or rice!

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up shot of a vibrant green Palak Paneer dish garnished with a swirl of cream, ginger juliennes, and a lemon wedge.  Steam gently rises from the dish.  A side of naan bread is slightly blurred in the background.
scenes.voice_over: Welcome! Today, we're making classic Palak Paneer, a creamy spinach and Indian cheese dish bursting with flavor.  It's easier than you think!

scenes.image_prompt: Overhead shot of ingredients arranged on a wooden board: Fresh spinach, paneer cubes, ginger, garlic, green chilies, tomatoes, and an onion.
scenes.voice_over: Let's gather our ingredients.  We'll need fresh spinach, paneer cheese, ginger, garlic, green chilies, tomatoes, onions, and a few spices.

scenes.image_prompt: Spinach being blanched in boiling water in a pot.
scenes.voice_over: First, blanch the spinach in boiling salted water for about a minute. This helps retain its vibrant green color.

scenes.image_prompt: A blender with the blanched spinach, ginger, garlic, and green chilies, ready to be pureed.
scenes.voice_over: Then, transfer the spinach to an ice bath. Once cooled, blend it with ginger, garlic, and green chilies into a smooth puree.

scenes.image_prompt: A pan with oil/ghee, cumin seeds spluttering, bay leaf, and sauteing onions.
scenes.voice_over: Heat oil or ghee in a pan. Add cumin seeds and a bay leaf. Once the seeds splutter, add chopped onions and sauté until golden brown.

scenes.image_prompt: The pan with sauteed onions, garlic, tomatoes, and spices.
scenes.voice_over: Add chopped garlic, sauté until fragrant, and then add the chopped tomatoes. Cook until softened. Now, add turmeric powder, red chili powder, and asafoetida. Mix well.

scenes.image_prompt: Spinach puree being added to the pan with the sauteed spices and mixed together.
scenes.voice_over: Pour in the spinach puree, mix well, and simmer for 6-7 minutes until the spinach is cooked and the sauce thickens slightly. Season with salt.

scenes.image_prompt: Paneer cubes being gently added to the pan with the spinach sauce.
scenes.voice_over: Gently add the paneer cubes. Don't overcook them, we just want them heated through.  Stir in the cream and garam masala.

scenes.image_prompt: Close-up of the finished Palak Paneer, garnished with cream, ginger, and lemon/lime wedges, served with naan and rice.
scenes.voice_over: Garnish with a touch of cream, ginger juliennes, and a lemon or lime wedge. Serve hot with roti, naan, or rice. Enjoy your delicious homemade Palak Paneer!

scenes.image_prompt: Text-based graphic showing nutrition information: Calories, Protein, Carbs, Fat per serving.
scenes.voice_over: Per serving, this Palak Paneer packs approximately 517 calories, 28 grams of protein, 34 grams of carbs, and 17 grams of fat.

cooking_tips: Blanching the spinach helps retain its vibrant green color.
Do not overcook the paneer, as it can become tough.
Kasuri methi adds a distinct flavor to the dish.
Adjust the amount of chili powder to control the spiciness.
